intro: Cephalotomandra panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian starfish plant, is a unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Panama, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its foliage consists of glossy, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Due to its ornamental value and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sought-after species among plant enthusiasts.
